html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: The Teacher Education Institute does not offer a program leading to an undergraduate degree, however it does offer undergraduate students a minor in education that introduces students to the profession of education and provides students an opportunity to explore education as a career and obtain a head start on their coursework leading to initial teacher certification through the University at Buffalo’s graduate school program, but

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p strong span
content: this minor cannot in itself lead directly to teacher certification

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: Although intended for those who will pursue certification in Adolescence education (Grades 7-12), the minor can be adapted for those interested in Early Childhood Education (birth to Grade 2) and/or Childhood Education (Grades 1-6).

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div h4 span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: Registration is open to students who formally apply to the minor and who receive confirmation of acceptance prior to registration. Applications to the minor must be filed with the Teacher Education Institution (TEI) office in 375 Baldy Hall. Applications must include UB DARS report and/or official transcripts from all institutions attended other than UB. Students must have a minimum GPA of 2.5 for admission.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div h4 span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: The minor in education consists of 19 credits as described below.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div h5 span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: LAI 350 Introduction to Education (4 credit hours)

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: ELP 405 Sociology of Education (3 credit hours) *, +

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div h5 span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: At least 9 credits (3 courses) chosen from the following electives:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: LAI 205 Introduction to Child Development & Learning +, #

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: LAI 416 Early Childhood Education Theory & Practice

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: LAI 490 Seminar and Practicum in Early Childhood

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: CEP 404 Introduction to the Rehabilitation of Substance Abuse & Addiction

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: * May be applicable to Adolescence initial teacher certification program at UB

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: + May be applicable to Childhood initial/professional teacher certification program at UB

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: # May be applicable to Early Childhood initial/professional teacher certification program at UB

content: Fall: Two courses from the list of electives

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: The first course (LAI 350) in the minor is an introductory course that is not part of the required coursework for certification. It does, however, have a field experience component, and early field experiences are required in the latest NYS Education Department regulations.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: The next two courses, CEP 400 and ELP 405, can be used to meet requirements for initial certification as an Adolescence teacher. The final three courses in the minor are electives, which may also meet teacher certification course requirements (depending upon which curricular option the student eventually pursues).

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: Students who take CEP 400, ELP 405, and LAI 414, and complete them successfully, and who later pursue a UB program leading to initial teacher certification at the Adolescence level may include these courses in their coursework toward initial certification (but not the master’s degree). This allows students to have a 9-credit head start toward their initial certification.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div h4 span
content: Provisional Admission into the Teacher Certification Program

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: Students who have completed 75 undergraduate credits in an approved major with a minimum GPA of 3.0 can apply on-line to an initial certification (i.e., advanced certificate without an Ed.M. degree) or initial/professional certification program (with Ed.M. degree) for provisional admission pending completion of their undergraduate degree. Students who have been provisionally admitted and who have completed 90 undergraduate credits may take two graduate level education courses (upon advisement) and include them in their graduate program in education.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div h4 span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: If you are interested in pursuing teacher certification through our graduate

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p b span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: initial or initial/professional teacher certification program curricular options, the following information regarding undergraduate degree and distribution requirements will assist you as you plan your undergraduate coursework.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div h5 span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: A baccalaureate degree in English, which includes at least 30 hours of coursework in English.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div h5 span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: A baccalaureate degree in an approved Foreign Language, which includes at least 30 hours of coursework in the Foreign Language.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div h5 span
html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: A baccalaureate degree in Mathematics, which includes at least 30 hours of coursework in Mathematics.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: The following mathematics distribution must also be met:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: 2 courses in linear and/or abstract Algebra

content: A baccalaureate degree in History or one of the Social Sciences (Anthropology, Sociology, Geography, Economics, or Political Science), which includes at least 21 credits in History or Geography and one Economics and one Political Science course.
